content:
Diagnosis:	Pancreatic adenocarcinoma (signet ring cell type), uncinate process

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Whipple's procedure

Histology:	pT3N1M0 (Stage IIB) signet ring cell adenocarcinoma, R0 resection, 2/18 lymph nodes positive

Current Situation:	Post-operative assessment for adjuvant chemotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent Whipple's procedure. He has made an excellent recovery from surgery with good wound healing and is now eating and drinking normally. His weight has stabilised at 72kg (pre-operative weight 78kg). His performance status is 1. His latest blood tests show CA19-9 has decreased from >20,000 pre-operatively to 850 currently.

On examination, his surgical wounds are well healed. His abdomen is soft and non-tender with no concerning features. Cardiorespiratory examination is unremarkable.

I have discussed adjuvant chemotherapy with modified FOLFIRINOX. He understands the aims of treatment and potential side effects. We will arrange baseline CT chest/abdomen/pelvis and proceed with cycle 1 in 2 weeks if imaging shows no evidence of recurrence. He will be reviewed prior to each cycle in this clinic.
